Translations.Text: And mention thou in the Book Musa: verily he was single- hearted, and was an apostle, prophet
And We cried unto him from the right side of the mount, and We drew him nigh for whispering
And We bestowed on him, out of Our mercy, his brother Harun, a prophet
And mention thou in the Book lsma'i; verily he was true in promise, and was apostle, prophet
And he was wont to command his household to the Prayer and the poor-rate, and he was with his Lord an approved one
And mention thou in the book ldris, verily he was a man of truth, a prophet
And We exalted him to a position lofty

These are they whom Allah hath favoured, from among the prophets, of the progeny of Adam and of them whom We bare with Nuh, and of the progeny of Ibrahim and Isra'il, and of those whom We have guided and chosen; whenever the revelations of the Compassionate were rehearsed unto them, they fell down prostrating themselves and weeping
Then there succeeded to them a posterity who neglected the prayers and followed lusts; so presently they shall meet with perdition
Excepting those who may repent and believe and work righteously; these shall enter the Garden and shall not be wronged at all
Gardens Everlasting, which the Compassionate hath promised unto his bondmen, unseen; verily His premise is ever to be fulfilled
They shall not hear therein any vain word, but they shall hear only peace; and therein they shall have their provision morning and evening
Such is the Garden which We shall cause those of Our bondmen to inherit who have been God-fearing
And we descend not except by the command of thy Lord: his is whatsoever is before us and whatsoever is behind us and whatsoever is in-between; and thy Lord is not a forgetter
Lord of the heavens and the earth and that which is betwixt the twain; so Him worship thou, and endure patiently in His worship; knowest thou any as his compeer
